abstracts.cdata!:
This Results Profile focuses on what
            children learn in Turkey. In the past decade, Turkey has
            made great progress in getting its children enrolled in
            primary school. But now the quality of that education is
            coming under scrutiny. Research showed that Turkish
            teenagers were behind their counterparts in other comparable
            countries. The quality of education is uneven across Turkey.
            City schools tend to be stronger. More affluent children
            tend to go to better schools and perform better once there.
            Of all the countries in the Europe and Central Asia region,
            only Tajikistan's population ranks education as a
            higher priority than do Turks. With support from the World
            Bank, Turkey was tackling education policy. One priority was
            better training and better pay for teachers. Another was a
            focus on early childhood education. Yet another was
            curriculum reform. Some educators see Turkish students on
            the world's stage, and want to prepare them to take
            their place in a global market.
